name: Congenital Diaphragmatic Hernia with Pulmonary Hypertension
chief_complaint: My baby is breathing very fast and looks blue
physical_findings: diminished breath sounds on affected side
prognosis: Guarded, depends on degree of pulmonary hypoplasia and response to therapy
description: A life-threatening congenital anomaly where abdominal organs herniate into the chest cavity through a diaphragmatic defect, causing pulmonary hypoplasia and severe pulmonary hypertension. Typically presents in neonates with respiratory failure.
multiple_choice: Congenital Diaphragmatic Hernia with Pulmonary Hypertension
